main event: On 6 October 1957 at 1935Z, a ground-radar observation was conducted at Tocumen Tower, Panama C.Z. A round, white object, roughly 20 inches in diameter, was sighted 23 degrees above the horizon, trailing slowly for a duration of 1 minute. The conclusion was speculated to be a weather balloon or aircraft, and it was later confirmed as Venus.
interesting points: The object was described as round, white, and around 20 inches in diameter.
The sighting was made using ground-radar at Tocumen Tower, Panama C.Z.
The slow trailing of the object lasted for approximately 1 minute.
Initial speculation included the object being a weather balloon or aircraft.
The eventual confirmation identified the object as the planet Venus.
sighted object: round, white object, approximately 20 inches in diameter
